de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.common
Interface Operation<T>

Type Parameters:
T - They result type of the operation. e.g. LookupOperation in a DHTNode should return a DHTValue.
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractFSOperation, AbstractOperation, BTOperation, BTOperationChoking, BTOperationDistribute, BTOperationDownload, BTOperationKeepAlive, BTOperationPeerStarter, BTOperationSendStatistic, BTOperationUnchokingNum, BTOperationUpload, BTOperationValueLookup, CloseOperation, DownloadOperation, DownloadOperation, LookupOperation, ServerJoinOperation, StartOperation, StoreOperation, StoreOperation
public interface Operation<T>

This class realizes the command pattern for common operations in a distributed system. Typically, if some action should take place in a component of a host, the action will be represented by an operation object providing the required functionality. Examples of operations could be: JoinOperation, SearchOperation, DisconnectOperation etc.

The basic operation provides the knowledge about its state: finished or not and if finished - successful or not. The main functionality of this class is its ability to be scheduled in the simulator.

Note that not all components are Operation-based. Components which work with operations must implement the SupportOperations interface.

Version:
3.0, 11/25/2007
Author:
Sebastian Kaune , Konstantin Pussep
See Also:
OperationCallback, SupportOperations

Method Summary
 SupportOperations getComponent()
          Returns the component to which a specific operation object belongs to.
 int getOperationID()
          By constructing a new operation instance, each operation is assigned a globally unique operation identifier.
 T getResult()
          The result of the operation, which is only not null if the operation finished successfully.
 boolean isFinished()
          This method returns information whether a given operation is finished or not regardless of whether it finished successfully or failed.
 boolean isSuccessful()
          This method returns information whether a given operation was successful or not.
 void scheduleAtTime(long executionTime)
          This method schedules the operation at an absolute point in time irrespective of the current simulation time.
 void scheduleImmediately()
          Schedules the operation with the time delay of zero into the scheduler.
 void scheduleWithDelay(long delay)
          This method schedules the operation relatively to the current simulation time by using an additional delay.
 

Method Detail

isSuccessful

boolean isSuccessful()
This method returns information whether a given operation was successful or not. If the operation has not finished yet it must return false.

Returns:
returns true if this operation was successful.

isFinished

boolean isFinished()
This method returns information whether a given operation is finished or not regardless of whether it finished successfully or failed.

Returns:
returns true if this operation is finished.

getOperationID

int getOperationID()
By constructing a new operation instance, each operation is assigned a globally unique operation identifier. That is, each operation can be differentiated by another one using this identifier. For debugging purposes the operation id is even unique among all hosts in the simulator.

Returns:
the globally unique operation identifier

scheduleImmediately

void scheduleImmediately()
Schedules the operation with the time delay of zero into the scheduler. The sense of this method is that the operations should be executed outside of the callers call context.

scheduleWithDelay

void scheduleWithDelay(long delay)
This method schedules the operation relatively to the current simulation time by using an additional delay. That is, the scheduling time t is given by t = currentTime + delay.

Parameters:
delay - - relative (virtual) time delay after which the operation will be executed

scheduleAtTime

void scheduleAtTime(long executionTime)
This method schedules the operation at an absolute point in time irrespective of the current simulation time. More precisely the simulation will be executed at time t = max(currentTime,executionTime)

Parameters:
executionTime - the absolute point in time to execute this operation

getComponent

SupportOperations getComponent()
Returns the component to which a specific operation object belongs to.

Returns:
the component to which a specific operation object belongs to

getResult

T getResult()
The result of the operation, which is only not null if the operation finished successfully.

Returns:
operation result
